text: From bottle at VCBF; pours, clear dark red with a white head. Aroma is cherries and slightly wood. Taste is medium bitter, dry cherries some yeast. Sparkling, dry mouthfeel, light to medium body. Nice one!
Bottle shared. Hazy red with a small light pink head. Aroma of tart cherries, oak and light funk. Flavour is light sweet and moderate sour. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.
0,75l bottle shared by a friend @ One Pint Pub. Pours clear deep ruby red with a low head. Aroma is sour malts with cherries. Flavor is sour malts and sour cherries. Awesome.

Mooie rode kleur met weinig wit schuim. Geur: kriek en wat amandel. Smaak: licht zuur, vlezig en ietwat vettig. Zeer weinig krieken in de smaak. Redelijk volmondig. Licht sprankelende koolzuurprikkel. Afdronk: licht zurig, droog.

Bottle sample at a tasting at troubless place. Thanks DSG. Reddish with pinkish-beige head. The aroma has lots of cherry, yogurt and strawberry. Sourish flavor with notes of cherry, wood, lemon, sweetish, some strawberry and vinegar, dry. Medium-bodied. Very nice.

Bottle sample at a tasting, thanks DSG. Hazy red. Splendid aroma of cherries, wood, vanilla, funky. Sweetish, sour, cherries, lactic, red wine, wood, vanilla flavors. Medium-bodied, oily and rounded mouthfeel. Very good.

Bottle shared at a tasting at troubless place. Thanks David K. for this bottle. Nice red color. Great juicy cherries aroma with some oak and a bit of yeast. Sweetish and tart flavor, with cherries, oak, and a light bitterish hint. Medium-bodied. Great.

Hazy red colour with a pink big head that fades soon, leaving a good lace. Aroma of cherries, hints of oak and sherry, banana. Medium body, normal carbonation. Taste is bitter and dry, but not as much as in other beers of tis kind, cherries, almonds, oak. Good.

0.375 l bottle from De Bierkoning, bottled in March 2016. Clear, deep ruby with a large, fluffy, rather quickly collapsing, pinkish head. Sourish-fruity, somewhat musty aroma of cherries, bitter almond, some cellar notes, straw and hints of oak. Moderately sour, fruity and a little musty taste of cherries, bitter almond, oak, straw dank cellar and a touch of raspberries, followed by a medium long, moderately tart, slightly vinous, oaky finish. Medium body, moderately astringent and quite effervescent mouthfeel, average carbonation. Refreshing and easy to drink, but I dont really like that cellar note in here. This brewery still cannot totally convince me.
A relatively young brewery made a truly classic kriek. Beautiful nose, round, bold tastes of cherry, extremely fruity with a light sour touch to it. This is a true craft kriek beer. Lovely.

Bottle thnx to Kurt: 
Pours deep dark red, good pink head: 
smell is intense, aromatic cherries and slightly sour. Taste is Intense, sour, very fleshy cherries. very balanced. Perfect amount amount of cherries. No funk ( No lambic ) But everything else in it is nice. Lovely beer...

5/III/15 - 75cl bottle from the brewery @ Drunken Drivers tasting (home) - BB: n/a, bottled: 8/II/14 - bottle # 159/250 (2015-263) 
Clear ruby red beer, creamy off-white to beige head, little stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: sourish, funky, fruity, cherries, some lambic / wild yeast notes, spicy. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: very fruity, cherries, soft acidity, bitter touch, mainly nice fruity tartness though. Aftertaste: very fruity, cherries, little sour, bit funky, cherry candy. Nice stuff.
Bottle from tderoeck. Many thanks! Cloudy murky red colour. Almost no foam. Tart aroma of sour cherrys and cherry pits. Sour and refreshing, not very complex but good!

Bottle 0.75l from tderoeck at Train direction Vichte to Alvinne Craft Beer Festival 2015. Thank you very much Tim for giving us homework :-).Pour it hazy red color with small head.On the nose sweet, sour cherry.Taste and aroma of red fruita, cherry, sweet candy sugar, tart.Really good balamced sharpe and after smooth taste.Very good Kriek for me.

UPDATED: DEC 19, 2015 Courtesy of tderoeck at this years ACBF, shared with tderoeck and 77ships. First batch of a limitedly produced old school kriek on oud bruin, apparently only 250 bottles were made this time. Allegedly a resurrection of a similar beer having been brewed in the municipality of Lo-Reninge till 1963, where the southern part of Flanders still had a tradition of Flemish red with sour cherries, a tradition which has gone all but lost (Verhaeghe Echt Kriekenbier is among the last of the classic ones still produced). Off-white, loose and thin head, cloudy bronze colour with ruby hue; very fruity and estery aroma, sour cherries indeed, passion fruit, yoghurt, tannins, dry sherry, hints of caramel. This is reflected in the taste: utterly fruity, sour cherry flesh but stonefruit tannins as well, honeyish malt sweetness in the background, drying tartness reinforced with oaky tannins in the finish, long and genuine. Body is on the thin side though. Nevertheless: respect for bringing new life to this disappearing tradition.

Bottle, shared by tderoeck on a train Ghent-Vichte direction ACBF (Belgium). Thank you Tim! Pours hazy dark-red color, with some traces of a non-foam on the surface. Nose: cherries blast (very balanced tough), cellar. Mouth: peculiar fresh lambic beer, medium tart palate, fruity character. Lovely one (and rare). Again thank you Tim.

Thanks for this apparent rarity tderoeck! 750 ml. bottle sampled @ ACBF 2015. Bottled on 08/02/2014. Dark red, little head. Nose is thick yoghurt, lactic, overripe berries, krieken, plenty of sugar. Taste is similar, yoghurt overripe krieken, touch old and moldy, sugar, Thick sugar body. Doesnt fully work, maybe better fresh? Nowhere near as nice as their Oud Bruin.
Can at Drunken Drivers Tasting @ tderoecks place. Thanks guys. Pours orange, red no head. Smells like cherries, tart, raspberries. Harsh taste, very tasty, acidic, pretty decent.

February 8th, 2014 bottling, reninge krieken rood, vandewalle lo-reninge
Very cloudy, blood red with a small pinkish white head. Wheat aroma with sour cherry, some light pickle and sourdough yeastpistachio and oak. Taste maybe is a bit too sweet. Sour cherry, wood and a saison like bread-like taste dry finish, sweet throughout. Interesting beer.
